explanation: Agent A is correct. The parameter keep is only inspected (pointer arithmetic, comparisons) and passed as the source argument to memmove (whose prototype takes a const void *src). The function never modifies the object pointed to by keep, so per MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 it should be declared to point to a const-qualified type (e.g. const void *keep). Any helper macros/functions used (mp_ptr_diff_, mp_ptr_le_) should likewise accept pointers-to-const as appropriate. Note: changing the API may have backwards-compatibility implications, but that does not negate that the current code violates the “should” of Rule 8.13.
